evals.prompt: Write me a Python script that logs into the JETNET API and pulls a list of all Gulfstream G550s currently for sale. I need the registration number, year manufactured, and the owner company name for each one. My credentials are in environment variables JETNET_EMAIL and JETNET_PASSWORD.
evals.expected_output: A working Python script that: (1) authenticates with POST /api/Admin/APILogin using env vars, (2) looks up the G550 modelid via getAircraftModelList or uses the known modelid, (3) calls getAircraftList with forsale=true and the correct modlist, (4) extracts regnbr, yearmfr, and owner company name from results, (5) prints or returns the data.

evals.prompt: I have a tail number -- N525LX -- and I need to get the full aircraft record from JETNET including its maintenance history and engine details. Can you show me how to do this with the API? Walk me through the calls I need to make.
evals.expected_output: Clear explanation of the 3-step process: (1) GET /api/Aircraft/getRegNumber/{reg}/{securityToken} to resolve tail number to aircraftid, (2) GET /api/Aircraft/getEngine/{id}/{securityToken} for engine details, (3) GET /api/Aircraft/getMaintenance/{id}/{securityToken} for maintenance. Should include code examples and note that the securityToken goes in the URL path.

evals.prompt: I want to pull a report of all business jet ownership transactions from January 2023 through December 2024 -- basically who sold what to whom -- filtered to just Bombardier and Dassault aircraft. Export this to a CSV. Write me the script.
evals.expected_output: A Python script that: (1) authenticates, (2) calls getHistoryList or getHistoryListPaged with maketype=BusinessJet, make filter or modlist for Bombardier/Dassault models, startdate=01/01/2023, enddate=12/31/2024, (3) handles pagination if needed, (4) writes results to CSV with relevant fields.
